page.title: 10HOUSING
page.content:
AKELEY & LILLINGSTONE DAYRELL
The area is peppered with farmhouses, some large, some small, only one is of 1980 vintage. Akeley has local author- ity houses, but many of these are pri- vately owned. Buckingham University own property for rent in L. Dayrell and there are several bungalows and houses in this hamlet owned by Squire Robarts and his tenant farmer. In Akeley there is a mixed development of old cottages, post war houses, new first time homes which are very small and large archi- tect designed dwellings built on excess garden land sold to developers. There is no gas laid to the villages; heating is by solid fuel, electricity, oil or calor gas.
